009package imagingbook.common.color.quantize;
010
011import static imagingbook.common.math.Arithmetic.sqr;
012
013import java.awt.image.IndexColorModel;
014import java.util.Locale;
015
016import ij.process.ByteProcessor;
017import ij.process.ColorProcessor;
018import imagingbook.common.color.RgbUtils;
019
020public interface ColorQuantizer {
021        
022        public final static int MAX_RGB = 255;
023        
024        /**
025         * Retrieves the color map produced by this color quantizer.
026         * The returned array is in the format float[idx][rgb], where
027         * rgb = 0 (red), 1 (green), 2 (blue) and  0 &le; idx &lt; nColors.
028         * 
029         * @return The table of reference (quantization) colors.
030         */
031        public abstract float[][] getColorMap();
032        
033        // ---------------------------------------------------------------
034        
035        /**
036         * Returns the number of quantized colors.
037         * 
038         * @return the number of quantized colors
039         */
040        public default int getColorCount() {
041                return getColorMap().length;
042        }
043        
044        
045        /**
046         * Performs color quantization on the given full-color RGB image
047         * and creates an indexed color image.
048         * 
049         * @param cp The original full-color RGB image.
050         * @return The quantized (indexed color) image.
051         */
052        public default ByteProcessor quantize(ColorProcessor cp) {
053                float[][] colormap = this.getColorMap();
054                if (colormap.length > 256) 
055                        throw new RuntimeException("cannot index to more than 256 colors");
056                
057                int w = cp.getWidth();
058                int h = cp.getHeight();
059                
060                int[]  rgbPixels = (int[]) cp.getPixels();
061                byte[] idxPixels = new byte[rgbPixels.length];
062
063                for (int i = 0; i < rgbPixels.length; i++) {
064                        idxPixels[i] = (byte) findColorIndex(rgbPixels[i], colormap);
065                }
066
067                IndexColorModel idxCm = makeIndexColorModel(colormap);
068                return new ByteProcessor(w, h, idxPixels, idxCm);
069        }
070        
071        static IndexColorModel makeIndexColorModel(float[][] colormap) {
072                final int nColors = colormap.length;
073                byte[] rMap = new byte[nColors];
074                byte[] gMap = new byte[nColors];
075                byte[] bMap = new byte[nColors];
076                for (int i = 0; i < nColors; i++) {
077                        rMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][0]);
078                        gMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][1]);
079                        bMap[i] = floatToUnsignedByte(colormap[i][2]);
080                }
081                return new IndexColorModel(8, nColors, rMap, gMap, bMap);
082        }
083        
084        static byte floatToUnsignedByte(float x) {
085                int xi = Math.round(x);
086                if (xi < 0) {
087                        xi = 0;
088                }
089                else if (xi > MAX_RGB) {
090                        xi = MAX_RGB;
091                }
092                return (byte) (0xFF & xi);
093        }
094        
095        /**
096         * Performs color quantization on the given sequence of
097         * ARGB-encoded color values and returns a new sequence 
098         * of quantized colors.
099         * 
100         * @param origPixels The original ARGB-encoded color values.
101         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color values.
102         */
103        public default int[] quantize(int[] origPixels) {
104                int[] qantPixels = new int[origPixels.length];
105                for (int i = 0; i < origPixels.length; i++) {
106                        qantPixels[i] = quantize(origPixels[i]);
107                }
108                return qantPixels;
109        }
110        
111        /**
112         * Performs color quantization on the given ARGB-encoded color value and returns
113         * the associated quantized color.
114         * 
115         * @param rgb The original ARGB-encoded color value.
116         * @return The quantized ARGB-encoded color value.
117         */
118        public default int quantize(int rgb) {
119                final float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
120                int idx = findColorIndex(rgb, colormap);
121                int red = (int) (colormap[idx][0] + 0.5f);
122                int grn = (int) (colormap[idx][1] + 0.5f);
123                int blu = (int) (colormap[idx][2] + 0.5f);
124                return RgbUtils.encodeRgbToInt(red, grn, blu);
125        }
126        
127        /**
128         * Finds the color table index of the color that is "closest" to the supplied
129         * RGB color (minimum Euclidean distance in color space). This method may be
130         * overridden by inheriting classes, for example, to use quick indexing in the
131         * octree method.
132         * 
133         * @param p        Original color, encoded as an ARGB integer.
134         * @param colormap a color map (float)
135         * @return The associated color table index.
136         */
137        default int findColorIndex(int p, float[][] colormap) {
138//              float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
139                int[] rgb = RgbUtils.intToRgb(p);
140                int n = colormap.length;
141                float minD2 = Float.POSITIVE_INFINITY;
142                int minIdx = -1;
143                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
144                        final float red = colormap[i][0];
145                        final float grn = colormap[i][1];
146                        final float blu = colormap[i][2];
147                        float d2 = sqr(red - rgb[0]) + sqr(grn - rgb[1]) + sqr(blu - rgb[2]);   // dist^2
148                        if (d2 < minD2) {
149                                minD2 = d2;
150                                minIdx = i;
151                        }
152                }
153                return minIdx;
154        }
155        
156        default void listColorMap() {
157                float[][] colormap = getColorMap();
158                System.out.println("listColorMap: " + colormap.length);
159                int n = colormap.length;
160                for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {
161                        float red = colormap[i][0];
162                        float grn = colormap[i][1];
163                        float blu = colormap[i][2];
164                        System.out.format(Locale.US, "i=%3d: r=%6.1f g=%6.1f b=%6.1f\n", i, red, grn, blu);
165                }
166        }
167        
168        // -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
169        
170//      protected int log2(int n){
171//              if(n <= 0) throw new IllegalArgumentException();
172//              return 31 - Integer.numberOfLeadingZeros(n);
173//      }
174        
175//      protected int sqr(int k) {
176//              return k * k;
177//      }
178
179}
